comments.body: I love all of your ideas!
Yes also I would like to build below bedrock in the Overworld and also on top of the Nether roof. Please also make hardcore a thing definitely.
Que la mano sea más jande como en Java y poder acomodar tu ymbentario con un solo botan y poner el inventario de creativo como ja y el combate tambien
Plus, this way you know that they're not trading. First time I tried trading with a jobless villager I thought I just misclicked
Baby villager also dont have a shaking head animation when you trying trade.
Yes cool idea. Do you really want to keep seeing the same cobblestone over and over again?
This would open up so many new possibilities for addons and resource packs to essentially add new items and stuff. You got my vote!
Wait you can’t already in resource packs?

Good Idea! 

Although, it isnt parity because im pretty sure java or bedrock doesnt have this, so you could move this to another category or something

This is especially great for naturally occurring blocks. (coral, leaves, maybe grass blocks) Just not normal building blocks like wood or cobblestone

You have my vote!
The snow layer should also fall when the block underneath it is destroyed, instead of just disappear, just like on Bedrock Edition. These little feature should really be added in Java Edition

I love this idea. They might do this when they rework the Extreme Hills (Mountains) biome. It’s a little change and the snow layers should stack and have snowloggable blocks like bedrock. Bedrock is ahead of gameplay features at the moment.
for some reason, this works with regular coral, but not the fan variant.
Extremely overlooked feature. Really hope it gets added.

Bonjour

Salutation c'est actuellement dans Minecraft Bedrock cette fonction alors vous pouvez supprimer cette suggestion

Merci d'avance cordialement
It bothers me that Bedrock and Java are so different. It's ridiculous...
It's been different for too long though, if they changed it now it would ruin so many people's contraptions and infuriate half the community
Literally this will make redstone so easy on bedrock no more pain in the butt resdstone to make a 2x2 flush door
Its really annoying and frustrating when you see all the possible things, which can be created with Redstone in the Java edition, that i can just dream about.

This should absolutly be changed. If yall are thinking it would ruin your contraptions there will be a setting/gamerule called "old redstone mechanics" or somthing like that which will keep the old redstone on that world. It will be automatically on on world created before the updates so players dont have to look for it to fix their machines.
Why is my post always pending approval? It has happend to my last 5 posts, and they all end up getting deleted straight away, even tough I follow every rule......
I agree! (I think like you said there's an issue with the code so its not that simple) I would love to see the devs working on this after 1.17 comes out!
I know this is years old, but I tried giving bedrock a chance... This problem drove me straight into Java's arms. I will never play bedrock again until they fix this issue.

Forget about farms, I want less monsters to spawn at night, in Java it's one or two zombies, maybe a skeleton, in bedrock I rush to my bed because as soon as the sun even starts to set, 5 creepers and 2 skeletons spawn FIVE BLOCKS AWAY FROM ME
i want the spawn rates fixed like for the enderman farm its slower on xp gain cause of the spawn rate.
Villager socialise?

On Nintendo Switch Bedrock, the switch's keyboard prevents seeing your text change in-game, regardless of GUI changes, making autocomplete impossible without using a different keyboard system entirely. When working on a single-player map on Switch, I was disappointed when making and troubleshooting command block contraptions. The slow typing is what I get for working on console, but fighting the GUI and lack of autocomplete caused frustration that made me stop the project. Additionally, that map is stuck on switch until I can access realms, which is another problem for another post.

Because of the niche of this topic, I doubt it will get changed any time soon.

This one would be as useful as java one:
It combines the two styles.

I agree with your idea,
Indeed CommandBlocks in Bedrock Edition needs to have auto completion to make it easier for people to remember things like in Java Edition and it needs to have increased characters name limit from 15 to 30 or something or perhaps a way to view the input we made without the need to click on each command block while debugging.
I Also want the feature but is there any mods for it
i made a sword that i was so proud of and named it a clever name to be disappointed yet again because they have yet to add this parity
Doesn't really make sense IMO. Grass blocks are like 95% dirt
Or maybe your grass block becomes dirt when composting, as you are composting the grass, not the dirt.

I personally think this would be taking a step backwards, making Lapis, Bone Meal, and Inc Sacs unusable just goes on to confuse returning players who remember those as the old Blue, White, and Black dyes.

Adding the extra step of turning them into dye only hurts the process, and makes the game less enjoyable.

This is a case where Java should copy Bedrock, not the other way around.
385315484311 That would be like saying that you should be able to use cactus or flowers as dye in a crafting recipe. The new dyes were long-overdue, and this should be added to match java.
Silverfish aren't actually that threatening and them being able to climb blocks helps them feel more invasive and dangerous- I dig the idea!
Mobile touch controls were recently updated so hopefully we get this very soon.
Please add the possibility to create addons of other dimensions like in Java

Yeah I understand that some things with the off hand would be hard for mobile and console versions of bedrock but they should add at least add being able to duel wield and hold torches with the off hand.
I doubt this would be much of an issue for consoles.
This is semi-implemented, however you can only use shears
Please add this to bedrock edition.
This is actually gonna happen now in an update not sure when thou but least it's being added
That should be marked as released.

I agree I really think it's frustrating that we're not allowed to use our own custom skins. there's one that use  for playthroughs and servers and when i only have my switch on hand for my server i have to use a random skin from the marketplace 

 

(i just realized you posted this 5 years ago but i wholeheartedly agree)
And Bedrock Edition as well
Yes yes yesssssss I don't really play survival but this would be really good for redstone minigames
An aesthetic change I'd personally love.
The current Minecraft Bedrock sensitivity feels like a bug, like it should be able to go at least twice as fast as it currently can, for player vision sensitivity and cursor sensitivity.
Yes, please do!

As someone who owned a "pet shop" in my realms shopping district. It was so so difficult to transport the animals. Not to mention it was more of a pain when the bedrock mob despawn glitch would pop up.so much for all my hard work
...and most agree it's a nightmare. It should be added, but only as a world option that can be toggled off and on without cheats.
And in turn, armor stands with arms on java
Modos de juego Personalización y gameplay igual de como jaba y bedrock

I think it is necessary that they add things from both games, for example, the spectator mode was added to Java in 2014 and it was not until very recently that it was added to Bedrock, but the downside is that, unlike Java, we cannot see how it was done. creatures do. Like the hardcore mode that is not there and these are just a few, there are more. Both games must have the same.
Another very important thing is that I think snapshots should be playable in bedrock.

And also for java to have more color options when dying leather. We are able to mix colors and get a lot of colors, java doesn't have this. Also item frame corner sharing, java does it but why not bedrock

I agree, I play both Bedrock and Java. Its easy to set up a multiplayer world in bedrock, but its a mess with Java. I hope with the migration and the "friend system" that was mentioned at some point that we can play together on a multiplayer world w/o realms.
Sps
Fs
